segments.en: Hello, English learners.
segments.cn: 你好，英语学习者。

segments.en: Welcome back to another lesson here with us at EnglishPod.
segments.cn: 欢迎回到EnglishPod的另一节课。

segments.en: My name is Marco.
segments.cn: 我叫Marco。

segments.en: And I'm Erica.
segments.cn: 我是Erica。

segments.en: And today we are going to have a very casual, normal conversation.
segments.cn: 今天我们将进行一次非常随意、正常的对话。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: We're going to listen in on some small talk between a taxi driver and the passenger.
segments.cn: 我们将听一段出租车司机和乘客之间的小谈话。

segments.en: Small talk.
segments.cn: 小谈话。

segments.en: So that's basically... Small, short conversations you have with someone that you don't know very well.
segments.cn: 基本上就是... 你和不太熟悉的人进行的小、短的对话。

segments.en: Okay, so typical questions like, how old are you, where you're from, etc.
segments.cn: 好的，像“你多大了”、“你来自哪里”等典型问题。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: And this can be really hard for English learners because they often don't know what the right thing to say or the right thing to talk about.
segments.cn: 这对英语学习者来说可能很难，因为他们常常不知道该说什么或谈论什么。

segments.en: So we're going to give you a lot of phrases in this lesson that you can use in small talk.
segments.cn: 所以我们将在这节课中给你很多可以用于小谈话的短语。

segments.en: Okay, so we don't have anything to preview today, so let's listen to the dialogue for the first time and then we'll come back.
segments.cn: 好的，今天没有预览内容，所以我们先听对话，然后再回来。

segments.en: Where to, miss?
segments.cn: 请问去哪儿，小姐？

segments.en: Hi, Crenshaw and Hawthorne at the Holiday Inn that is on that corner.
segments.cn: 嗨，去假日酒店的Crenshaw和Hawthorne交叉口。

segments.en: Sure thing.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: So, where are you flying in from?
segments.cn: 那么，你是从哪里飞来的？

segments.en: From China.
segments.cn: 从中国。

segments.en: Really?
segments.cn: 真的？

segments.en: You don't look very Chinese to me, if you don't mind me saying so.
segments.cn: 如果你不介意我这么说，你看起来不太像中国人。

segments.en: It's fine.
segments.cn: 没关系。

segments.en: I am actually from Mexico.
segments.cn: 我其实来自墨西哥。

segments.en: I was in China on a business trip visiting some local companies that manufacture bathroom products.
segments.cn: 我在中国出差，拜访一些制造浴室产品的当地公司。

segments.en: Wow, sounds interesting.
segments.cn: 哇，听起来很有趣。

segments.en: Excuse me if I'm being a bit nosy, but how old are you?
segments.cn: 如果我有点好奇，请原谅我，但你多大了？

segments.en: Don't you know it's rude to ask a lady her age?
segments.cn: 你不知道问女士年龄是不礼貌的吗？

segments.en: Don't get me wrong, it's just that you seem so young and already doing business overseas.
segments.cn: 不要误解我的意思，只是你看起来这么年轻，已经在海外做生意了。

segments.en: Well, thank you.
segments.cn: 好吧，谢谢你。

segments.en: In that case, I am 26 years old, and what about you yourself?
segments.cn: 在这种情况下，我26岁，你呢？

segments.en: I'm 40 years old and was born and raised here in the good ol' US of A, although I have some Colombian heritage.
segments.cn: 我40岁，出生并在美国长大，虽然我有一些哥伦比亚血统。

segments.en: Really?
segments.cn: 真的？

segments.en: That's great!
segments.cn: 太好了！

segments.en: Do you speak Spanish?
segments.cn: 你会说西班牙语吗？

segments.en: Uh, yeah, of course.
segments.cn: 嗯，当然会。

segments.en: Alright,
segments.cn: 好吧，

segments.en: so I don't think this guy spoke much Spanish, do you?
segments.cn: 我觉得这个家伙不太会说西班牙语，你觉得呢？

segments.en: No, even though he has Colombian heritage, I think he doesn't speak much, but maybe he's just a little bit rusty.
segments.cn: 不，尽管他有哥伦比亚血统，我觉得他不太会说，可能只是有点生疏。

segments.en: Maybe, but what he does speak is English, and since this is EnglishPod, why don't we look at some of the phrases that they used for Smalltalk and Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 也许，但他会说英语，既然这是EnglishPod，为什么我们不看看他们在小谈话和流利表达中使用的一些短语呢？

segments.en: Alright, so today on Fluency Builder, we're gonna take a look at phrases that both the passenger and the taxi driver use to make Smalltalk.
segments.cn: 好的，今天在流利表达中，我们将看看乘客和出租车司机用来进行小谈话的短语。

segments.en: So why don't we start with the first one?
segments.cn: 那么我们为什么不从第一个开始呢？

segments.en: Alright, so the taxi driver tells the passenger that she doesn't look very Chinese, if you don't mind me saying so.
segments.cn: 好的，出租车司机告诉乘客，如果你不介意我这么说，你看起来不太像中国人。

segments.en: Right, so he said, you don't look very Chinese to me, if you don't mind me saying so.
segments.cn: 对，他说，你看起来不太像中国人，如果你不介意我这么说。

segments.en: If you don't mind me saying so.
segments.cn: 如果你不介意我这么说。

segments.en: So what does he mean by this last part of the sentence?
segments.cn: 那么这句话的最后部分是什么意思？

segments.en: Well, this is a phrase that we use to soften a sort of statement that might be a little bit rude.
segments.cn: 这是我们用来缓和可能有点无礼的陈述的短语。

segments.en: She could be Chinese.
segments.cn: 她可能是中国人。

segments.en: Yeah.
segments.cn: 是的。

segments.en: Right, so it may be a little bit rude to say that, but he kind of apologizes.
segments.cn: 对，所以说这可能有点无礼，但他有点道歉。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: Right, by saying if you don't mind me saying so.
segments.cn: 对，通过说如果你不介意我这么说。

segments.en: Okay, so for example, I could say, hey Marco, you look a little tired today if you don't mind me saying so.
segments.cn: 好的，例如，我可以说，嘿Marco，你今天看起来有点累，如果你不介意我这么说。

segments.en: Okay, so does it always go at the end?
segments.cn: 好的，这个短语总是放在最后吗？

segments.en: You could use it at the beginning.
segments.cn: 你可以放在开头。

segments.en: If you don't mind me saying so, I just don't think this is a good idea.
segments.cn: 如果你不介意我这么说，我只是觉得这不是个好主意。

segments.en: Okay, very good.
segments.cn: 好的，非常好。

segments.en: So you can use this phrase in the beginning or at the end of a sentence.
segments.cn: 所以你可以在句子的开头或结尾使用这个短语。

segments.en: Right, and it makes your statement a little bit less rude.
segments.cn: 对，这样可以让你的陈述显得不那么无礼。

segments.en: If you don't mind me saying so.
segments.cn: 如果你不介意我这么说。

segments.en: Now again, he also apologizes a little bit when he says, excuse me if I am being a bit nosy but... Excuse me if I'm being a bit nosy but... Excuse me if I'm being a bit nosy but... Okay, so let's take a look at this.
segments.cn: 现在，他在说“如果我有点好奇，请原谅我，但...”时也稍微道歉了。

segments.en: Nosy.
segments.cn: 好奇。

segments.en: What's this?
segments.cn: 这是什么？

segments.en: Okay, when somebody is nosy, it means they are very curious.
segments.cn: 好的，当某人好奇时，意味着他们非常好奇。

segments.en: They are asking too many questions.
segments.cn: 他们问了太多问题。

segments.en: Yeah, asking more questions than they should ask.
segments.cn: 是的，问的问题比他们应该问的多。

segments.en: Right, so he apologizes and says, well, excuse me if I'm asking too many questions.
segments.cn: 对，所以他道歉并说，嗯，如果我问了太多问题，请原谅我。

segments.en: And then he asks her another question.
segments.cn: 然后他又问了她一个问题。

segments.en: He asks her how old she is.
segments.cn: 他问她多大了。

segments.en: Right, so again, it's a polite way of maybe asking a question that might be a little bit sensitive.
segments.cn: 对，所以这又是一个礼貌的方式，可能是在问一个有点敏感的问题。

segments.en: Yeah, or a little bit impolite.
segments.cn: 是的，或者有点不礼貌。

segments.en: Okay, so of course asking a woman her age maybe is a little bit impolite, right?
segments.cn: 好的，当然问一个女人的年龄可能有点不礼貌，对吧？

segments.en: Yes, typically women don't like that too much.
segments.cn: 是的，通常女性不太喜欢这样。

segments.en: But our next phrase, we heard the taxi driver say, don't get me wrong.
segments.cn: 但我们下一个短语，我们听到出租车司机说，不要误解我的意思。

segments.en: Don't get me wrong.
segments.cn: 不要误解我的意思。

segments.en: Don't get me wrong.
segments.cn: 不要误解我的意思。

segments.en: Okay, so don't get me wrong.
segments.cn: 好的，所以不要误解我的意思。

segments.en: He says, well, don't misunderstand what I'm saying.
segments.cn: 他在说，嗯，不要误解我的意思。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: This phrase is used so commonly in English that I think it would help us to hear some examples.
segments.cn: 这个短语在英语中使用得非常普遍，我认为听一些例子会对我们有帮助。

segments.en: Example one.
segments.cn: 例子一。

segments.en: Don't get me wrong.
segments.cn: 不要误解我的意思。

segments.en: It's not that I think you stole my computer.
segments.cn: 我不是说我认为你偷了我的电脑。

segments.en: It's just that you were the only one who could get into my room.
segments.cn: 只是你是唯一一个能进我房间的人。

segments.en: Example two.
segments.cn: 例子二。

segments.en: I do have a few problems with the plan, but don't get me wrong.
segments.cn: 我确实对这个计划有一些问题，但不要误解我的意思。

segments.en: I still think it's a good idea.
segments.cn: 我仍然认为这是个好主意。

segments.en: Example three.
segments.cn: 例子三。

segments.en: Oh, don't get me wrong.
segments.cn: 哦，不要误解我的意思。

segments.en: I think John's a nice guy.
segments.cn: 我认为John是个好人。

segments.en: He's just a bit disorganized.
segments.cn: 只是他有点杂乱。

segments.en: All right, very good example.
segments.cn: 好的，非常好的例子。

segments.en: So don't get me wrong, right?
segments.cn: 所以不要误解我的意思，对吧？

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: And now for the final phrase on putting it together today.
segments.cn: 现在是今天最后一个短语的总结。

segments.en: Well, the passenger, the woman says her age, and she says, I'm 26 years old.
segments.cn: 好吧，乘客，那个女人说她的年龄，她说，我26岁。

segments.en: And what about yourself?
segments.cn: 你呢？

segments.en: What about yourself?
segments.cn: 你呢？

segments.en: What about yourself?
segments.cn: 你呢？

segments.en: All right, now, this sentence isn't very correct, actually, right?
segments.cn: 好的，现在，这句话其实不太正确，对吧？

segments.en: Yeah, technically, it's not correct in grammar, but it is used so commonly every day by American English speakers that we thought we'd show it to you.
segments.cn: 是的，从语法上讲，它不正确，但它在美国英语使用者中非常常见，所以我们想给你展示。

segments.en: Okay, so you would say, I am 26 years old, and what about you?
segments.cn: 好的，你会说，我26岁，你呢？

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: Okay, but commonly, you will hear people say, what about yourself?
segments.cn: 好的，但通常你会听到人们说，你自己呢？

segments.en: And if you use this, you'll sound really fluent and really native-like.
segments.cn: 如果你这样说，你听起来会非常流利，像个本地人。

segments.en: Okay, very good.
segments.cn: 好的，非常好。

segments.en: So what about yourself?
segments.cn: 那你自己呢？

segments.en: So again, it's just like, what about you?
segments.cn: 所以再一次，这就像，你呢？

segments.en: So I could say, hey, Marco, I'm going away on holiday this weekend, and what about yourself?
segments.cn: 我可以说，嘿，Marco，我这个周末要去度假，你自己呢？

segments.en: Okay, what about yourself?
segments.cn: 好的，你自己呢？

segments.en: So we've taken a look at these four phrases on putting it together.
segments.cn: 我们已经看了这四个短语的组合。

segments.en: Why don't we listen to the dialogue for the second time?
segments.cn: 我们再听一次对话吧？

segments.en: We're going to slow it down a little bit, and then we'll come back and take a look at some vocabulary words on language takeaway.
segments.cn: 我们会稍微放慢速度，然后再回来看看一些语言要点的词汇。

segments.en: Where to, miss?
segments.cn: 请问去哪儿，小姐？

segments.en: Hi, Crenshaw and Hawthorne at the Holiday Inn that is on that corner.
segments.cn: 嗨，Crenshaw和Hawthorne在那个角落的假日酒店。

segments.en: Sure thing.
segments.cn: 没问题。

segments.en: So, where are you flying in from?
segments.cn: 那么，你是从哪里飞来的？

segments.en: From China.
segments.cn: 从中国。

segments.en: Really?
segments.cn: 真的吗？

segments.en: You don't look very Chinese to me, if you don't mind me saying so.
segments.cn: 如果你不介意我这么说，你看起来不太像中国人。

segments.en: It's fine.
segments.cn: 没关系。

segments.en: I am actually from Mexico.
segments.cn: 我其实来自墨西哥。

segments.en: I was in China on a business trip, visiting some local companies that manufacture bathroom products.
segments.cn: 我在中国出差，拜访一些制造浴室产品的当地公司。

segments.en: Wow, sounds interesting.
segments.cn: 哇，听起来很有趣。

segments.en: Excuse me if I'm being a bit nosy, but how old are you?
segments.cn: 抱歉我有点好奇，但你多大了？

segments.en: Don't you know it's rude to ask a lady her age?
segments.cn: 你不知道问女士年龄是不礼貌的吗？

segments.en: Don't get me wrong.
segments.cn: 别误会我。

segments.en: It's just that you seem so young and already doing business overseas.
segments.cn: 只是你看起来这么年轻，已经在海外做生意了。

segments.en: Well, thank you.
segments.cn: 好吧，谢谢你。

segments.en: In that case, I am 26 years old.
segments.cn: 在这种情况下，我26岁。

segments.en: And what about yourself?
segments.cn: 那你自己呢？

segments.en: I am 40 years old and was born and raised here in the good old U.S.
segments.cn: 我40岁，出生并在这里长大，老美利坚合众国。

segments.en: of A.
segments.cn: 的A。

segments.en: Although I have some Colombian heritage.
segments.cn: 虽然我有一些哥伦比亚血统。

segments.en: Really?
segments.cn: 真的吗？

segments.en: That's great.
segments.cn: 太好了。

segments.en: Do you speak some Spanish?
segments.cn: 你会说一些西班牙语吗？

segments.en: Yeah, of course.
segments.cn: 是的，当然。

segments.en: Well, we've got some interesting vocabulary words and phrases here in Language Takeaway.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们在语言要点中有一些有趣的词汇和短语。

segments.en: And the first one... Well, after she gets in the taxi and tells him where she wants to go, he answers by saying, Sure thing.
segments.cn: 第一个... 好吧，在她上出租车并告诉他她想去哪里后，他回答说，没问题。

segments.en: Sure thing.
segments.cn: 没问题。

segments.en: Sure thing.
segments.cn: 没问题。

segments.en: Sure thing.
segments.cn: 没问题。

segments.en: So if I say, yeah, sure thing, what does that mean?
segments.cn: 所以如果我说，是的，没问题，这是什么意思？

segments.en: Well, let's listen to some examples to help us understand.
segments.cn: 好吧，让我们听一些例子来帮助我们理解。

segments.en: Example one.
segments.cn: 示例一。

segments.en: Do you mind lending me a hundred bucks?
segments.cn: 你介意借我一百块吗？

segments.en: Sure thing.
segments.cn: 没问题。

segments.en: Example two.
segments.cn: 示例二。

segments.en: Could you please send me the email by the end of the day?
segments.cn: 你能在今天结束前把邮件发给我吗？

segments.en: Sure thing.
segments.cn: 没问题。

segments.en: Example three.
segments.cn: 示例三。

segments.en: Do you mind lending me a hundred bucks?
segments.cn: 你介意借我一百块吗？

segments.en: Sure thing.
segments.cn: 没问题。

segments.en: Could you please send me the email by the end of the day?
segments.cn: 你能在今天结束前把邮件发给我吗？

segments.en: Sure thing.
segments.cn: 没问题。

segments.en: Example four.
segments.cn: 示例四。

segments.en: Can you get some milk on the way home?
segments.cn: 你能在回家的路上买些牛奶吗？

segments.en: Sure thing, I'm on my way now.
segments.cn: 没问题，我现在就去。

segments.en: Okay, so sure thing, basically, yeah, no problem, or okay.
segments.cn: 好的，所以没问题，基本上就是，是的，没问题，或者好的。

segments.en: Or I'll do it.
segments.cn: 或者我会去做。

segments.en: I'll do it.
segments.cn: 我会去做。

segments.en: Yep.
segments.cn: 是的。

segments.en: It's fine.
segments.cn: 没关系。

segments.en: Yep.
segments.cn: 是的。

segments.en: So it's a very common way you will hear this a lot when somebody agrees or says, yes, no problem.
segments.cn: 所以这是一个非常常见的说法，当有人同意或说，是的，没问题时，你会经常听到。

segments.en: Yeah, and again, it will help you sound really native-like to use this phrase.
segments.cn: 是的，再次使用这个短语会让你听起来非常像本地人。

segments.en: Well, the next one, the taxi driver says, I was born and raised here.
segments.cn: 好吧，下一个，出租车司机说，我在这里出生和长大。

segments.en: I was born and raised here.
segments.cn: 我在这里出生和长大。

segments.en: Born and raised.
segments.cn: 出生和长大。

segments.en: Okay, so this is a way of saying I was born in this country and I haven't left this country.
segments.cn: 好的，这是一种说法，表示我在这个国家出生，并且没有离开这个国家。

segments.en: That's right, so I'm from this country.
segments.cn: 没错，所以我来自这个国家。

segments.en: Okay, born and raised here in the good old US of A.
segments.cn: 好吧，出生和长大在老美利坚合众国。

segments.en: Good old US of A.
segments.cn: 老美利坚合众国。

segments.en: The good old US of A.
segments.cn: 老美利坚合众国。

segments.en: So this is a pretty interesting way of saying America.
segments.cn: 所以这是一种有趣的说法，指的是美国。

segments.en: Right, it's actually more of a phrase, right?
segments.cn: 对，这实际上更像是一个短语，对吧？

segments.en: The good old US of A.
segments.cn: 老美利坚合众国。

segments.en: Yep.
segments.cn: 是的。

segments.en: Okay, so it means the good United States of America.
segments.cn: 好吧，这意味着美利坚合众国。

segments.en: Yeah, it's kind of a fond way or a friendly way of describing America.
segments.cn: 是的，这是一种亲切或友好的方式来描述美国。

segments.en: All right, and we have one more word for language takeaway.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们还有一个语言要点的词。

segments.en: Well, the taxi driver was talking about his Colombian heritage.
segments.cn: 好吧，出租车司机在谈论他的哥伦比亚血统。

segments.en: Colombian heritage.
segments.cn: 哥伦比亚血统。

segments.en: Heritage.
segments.cn: 血统。

segments.en: All right, so if I have Colombian heritage, what does that mean?
segments.cn: 好吧，如果我有哥伦比亚血统，这意味着什么？

segments.en: Your grandmother or, you know, grandfather or great-grandmother or someone in your family is from Colombia.
segments.cn: 你的祖母，或者，你知道，祖父或曾祖母，或者你家里有人来自哥伦比亚。

segments.en: Okay, and what about the word heritage by itself?
segments.cn: 好吧，单独说血统这个词呢？

segments.en: Yeah, so your heritage is basically your culture, your...
segments.cn: 是的，所以你的血统基本上是你的文化，你的...

segments.en: Yeah, your customs, your history.
segments.cn: 是的，你的习俗，你的历史。

segments.en: Okay, so heritage.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以血统。

segments.en: A country rich in heritage.
segments.cn: 一个拥有丰富血统的国家。

segments.en: Lots of good old historical culture in that country.
segments.cn: 那个国家有很多优秀的历史文化。

segments.en: Okay, very good.
segments.cn: 好吧，非常好。

segments.en: Now it's time for us to listen to the dialogue for the last time.
segments.cn: 现在是我们最后一次听对话的时候了。

segments.en: Now we can understand all these phrases and these great words that we've just looked at.
segments.cn: 现在我们可以理解我们刚刚看到的所有这些短语和伟大的词汇。

segments.en: And then we'll come back and talk a little bit more.
segments.cn: 然后我们再回来聊聊。

segments.en: Where to, miss?
segments.cn: 请问去哪儿，小姐？

segments.en: Hi, Crenshaw and Hawthorne at the Holiday Inn that is on that corner.
segments.cn: 嗨，Crenshaw和Hawthorne在那个角落的假日酒店。

segments.en: Sure thing.
segments.cn: 没问题。

segments.en: So, where are you flying in from?
segments.cn: 那么，你是从哪里飞来的？

segments.en: From China.
segments.cn: 从中国。

segments.en: Really?
segments.cn: 真的？

segments.en: You don't look very Chinese to me, if you don't mind me saying so.
segments.cn: 如果你不介意我这么说，你看起来不太像中国人。

segments.en: It's fine, I am actually from Mexico.
segments.cn: 没关系，我其实是墨西哥人。

segments.en: I was in China on a business trip, visiting some local companies that manufacture bathroom products.
segments.cn: 我在中国出差，拜访一些制造浴室产品的当地公司。

segments.en: Wow, sounds interesting.
segments.cn: 哇，听起来很有趣。

segments.en: Excuse me if I'm being a bit nosy, but how old are you?
segments.cn: 对不起，如果我有点好奇，但你多大了？

segments.en: Don't you know it's rude to ask a lady her age?
segments.cn: 你不知道问女士年龄是不礼貌的吗？

segments.en: Don't get me wrong, it's just that you seem so young and already doing business overseas.
segments.cn: 不要误解我，只是你看起来太年轻了，已经在海外做生意了。

segments.en: Well, thank you.
segments.cn: 好吧，谢谢你。

segments.en: In that case, I am 26 years old, and what about you yourself?
segments.cn: 那么，我26岁，你呢？

segments.en: I'm 40 years old and was born and raised here in the good old US of A, although I have some Colombian heritage.
segments.cn: 我40岁，在美国出生长大，虽然我有一些哥伦比亚血统。

segments.en: Really?
segments.cn: 真的？

segments.en: That's great.
segments.cn: 太好了。

segments.en: Do you speak Spanish?
segments.cn: 你会说西班牙语吗？

segments.en: Yeah, of course.
segments.cn: 是的，当然。

segments.en: So Marco, this taxi driver makes a bit of a mistake when he asks the woman how old she is.
segments.cn: 所以马尔科，这个出租车司机在问那个女人多大时犯了个小错误。

segments.en: Yes, exactly.
segments.cn: 是的，没错。

segments.en: There are a couple of questions that in some cultures are considered to be normal and okay, but in other cultures they're not really well accepted.
segments.cn: 有几个问题在某些文化中被认为是正常的，但在其他文化中并不被接受。

segments.en: Okay, so in Anglo culture, for example, it's really impolite to ask a woman how old she is.
segments.cn: 好吧，比如在盎格鲁文化中，问女人多大是非常不礼貌的。

segments.en: Right, women are a little bit more sensitive about their age, others aren't so much, but it's usually better to just not ask.
segments.cn: 对，女性对年龄更敏感，其他人则不太在意，但通常最好不要问。

segments.en: And what else should we avoid talking about in small talk?
segments.cn: 还有什么我们应该避免在闲聊中谈论的？

segments.en: Well, for example, when you ask a person their occupation, you can ask what they do for a living, but don't ask how much money they make.
segments.cn: 嗯，比如，当你问一个人的职业时，你可以问他们的工作，但不要问他们赚多少钱。

segments.en: Anglo people are really sensitive about talking about money.
segments.cn: 盎格鲁人对谈论金钱非常敏感。

segments.en: We hate talking about money.
segments.cn: 我们讨厌谈论金钱。

segments.en: Right, so don't ask somebody their salary or how much money they make.
segments.cn: 对，所以不要问别人他们的薪水或赚多少钱。

segments.en: It's just not considered to be polite.
segments.cn: 这被认为是不礼貌的。

segments.en: And another good one to be careful of is asking if someone is married or not.
segments.cn: 还有一个需要小心的问题是问某人是否已婚。

segments.en: Right, sometimes you're just being friendly and you want to know if that person has family or something, but you have to be careful when and where you ask this question.
segments.cn: 对，有时你只是想表现得友好，想知道那个人是否有家庭，但你必须小心何时何地问这个问题。

segments.en: Right, so if they've mentioned their family, if they talked about their kids or something else to do with their family, then it's okay.
segments.cn: 对，如果他们提到过家庭，谈论过孩子或其他家庭相关的事情，那就可以。

segments.en: Right, you can say, well, how long have you been married?
segments.cn: 对，你可以说，嗯，你结婚多久了？

segments.en: Yeah.
segments.cn: 是的。

segments.en: But if a guy asks a girl, oh, are you married?
segments.cn: 但如果一个男生问一个女生，哦，你结婚了吗？

segments.en: It kind of sounds like maybe he's interested in her or that he's trying to come on to her and to be maybe more than friendly, right?
segments.cn: 听起来就像他对她感兴趣，或者他想对她表现得比朋友更亲密，对吧？

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: Okay, so some great small talk tips and phrases here at EnglishPod.
segments.cn: 好吧，这里有一些很好的闲聊技巧和短语在EnglishPod。

segments.en: Now, if you have any questions about this lesson or any other lessons, be sure to visit our website at EnglishPod.com.
segments.cn: 现在，如果你对这节课或其他课程有任何问题，请务必访问我们的网站EnglishPod.com。

segments.en: And if you also have any doubts about which questions you think are appropriate of asking somebody, yeah, come onto the website and let us know.
segments.cn: 如果你对哪些问题适合问别人有任何疑问，也请来我们的网站告诉我们。

segments.en: So thanks for downloading, you guys, and until next time, goodbye.
segments.cn: 所以谢谢你们的下载，直到下次，再见。
